intro: Wikstroemia lungtzeensis, commonly known as the Lungtze荛花, is a flowering plant species native to China. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers, which are usually white or pale yellow, bloom in spring and are followed by small, woody fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
